improve dvr port update under large scale deployment

update port may takes an excessive number of seconds
to complete if dvr routers are running on more than 100
compute nodes. This patch tries to save some time by removing
unnecessary calls inside looping through hosts.

Change-Id: Ide740e0c5c43c2d2b842460a37c8ce125da12b28
Closes-Bug: #1830456
(cherry picked from commit 00eb6f26f6165a00d647d2bf35fb7996534cfc09)

commit_message:
improve dvr port update under large scale deployment

update port may takes an excessive number of seconds
to complete if dvr routers are running on more than 100
compute nodes. This patch tries to save some time by removing
unnecessary calls inside looping through hosts.

Change-Id: Ide740e0c5c43c2d2b842460a37c8ce125da12b28
Closes-Bug: #1830456
(cherry picked from commit 00eb6f26f6165a00d647d2bf35fb7996534cfc09)

commit_message:
improve dvr port update under large scale deployment

update port may takes an excessive number of seconds
to complete if dvr routers are running on more than 100
compute nodes. This patch tries to save some time by removing
unnecessary calls inside looping through hosts.

Change-Id: Ide740e0c5c43c2d2b842460a37c8ce125da12b28
Closes-Bug: #1830456
(cherry picked from commit 00eb6f26f6165a00d647d2bf35fb7996534cfc09)

commit_message:
Remove deployed-server bootstrap resource

Removes the deployed-server bootstrap resource from the deployed-server
template as the equivalent functionality enabled by the scripts has been
moved to the tripleo-bootstrap ansible role provided by tripleo-common.

The environments and templates for the bootstrap resource are deprecated
in train and will be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: If5adc76190e986bae1346a3a7e8dda8a2bc92f27
Depends-On: Idc13a88481ae618f0321009f49acf71e68258b95
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

commit_message:
Add cluster upgrade to the API

To enable the rolling upgrade ability of Kubernetes Cluster, this
patch is proposing a new API /upgrade to support upgrade the
base operating system of nodes and the version of Kubernetes, even
add-ons running on the k8s cluster:

POST <ClusterID>/actions/upgrade

And the post body will be:

{
    "cluster_template": 'dd9cc5ed-3a2b-11e9-9233-fa163e46bcc2',
    "max_batch_size": 1,
    "nodegroup": "production_group"
}

Co-Authored-By: Feilong Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Task: 30168
Story: 2002210

Change-Id: Ia168877778aa0d473383eb06b1c8a16dc06b0576

commit_message:
Software RAID: Fix shell commands

Pass an array to utils.execute() or enforce string usage
via 'shell=True', but don't mix.

Follow-up to Id20302537f7994982c7584af546a7e7520e9612b

Change-Id: I2e6c628360aecf81039089af78b19fe6a956e564

commit_message:
Remove nova-consoleauth

The nova-consoleauth service was deprecated during the Rocky release [1]
and has not been necessary since unless you're using cells v1. As Kolla
has never supported cells v1, which is finally being removed during
Train [2], we can get ahead of the curve and stop deploying
nova-consoleauth immediately.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/implemented/convert-consoles-to-objects.html
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/remove-cells-v1/

Change-Id: I7fe042f77bac7736856d34adee6c9a17ed39e35b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove curl from images

There is no need for curl, per se, in the loci images.
Should some project consume loci images and require curl added,
then it's that project duty to add curl inside it.

Change-Id: I7c45ec5fcf14a737d59885ccf4bc8eeb558f9dd8

commit_message:
Fix fetch_wheels to work with hierahical registries

This patch fixes fetch_wheels script to work with images
stored in hierarchical folders like

 registry/foo/bar/myImage:latest

Change-Id: I7b15709417dcdc17ae43e13add7770278289fab9

security context on the pod template.

readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

Change-Id: I9bf05ab5c21f9afbe269e1566cfecd20b3c086c0
'}]
commit_message:
Ingress: Add pod/container security context

This updates the etcd chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template.

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

Change-Id: I9bf05ab5c21f9afbe269e1566cfecd20b3c086c0

commit_message:
Implement tripleo container image list command

This patch implements the tripleo container image list command, reading
for a remote registry URL, e.g. localhost:8787.

Returns a single column ascii table with full names of each image
discovered.

Change-Id: I44d19692fb7ab16797460215a98baf75e6b82034

The gateway ip should be 192.168.24.2 as the 2 NIC example from step 5
earlier in the doc set $IP to 192.168.24.2. In this example,
192.168.24.1 is never actually assigned anywhere so it can't be the
gateway ip.

The OS::TripleO::Services::MasqueradeNetworks service is also included
by default with the environments/services/masquerade-networks.yaml
environments file as the network range (default:
192.168.24.0/24) needs to be masqueraded by default in order for any
launched instances to get external access.

Also fixes the value for the start of the public net allocation pool.

Also updates a usage of the deprecated environments/standalone.yaml in
favor of environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml.

commit_message:
Fix standalone docs for 2 NIC example

The gateway ip should be 192.168.24.2 as the 2 NIC example from step 5
earlier in the doc set $IP to 192.168.24.2. In this example,
192.168.24.1 is never actually assigned anywhere so it can't be the
gateway ip.

The OS::TripleO::Services::MasqueradeNetworks service is also included
by default with the environments/services/masquerade-networks.yaml
environments file as the network range (default:
192.168.24.0/24) needs to be masqueraded by default in order for any
launched instances to get external access.

Also fixes the value for the start of the public net allocation pool.

Also updates a usage of the deprecated environments/standalone.yaml in
favor of environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml.

Change-Id: If1633fc55fb35be4c564da8fff5f7259e0515a8f

commit_message:
Add Timer context manager class

This class creates a context that:
* Triggers a timeout exception if the timeout is set.
* Returns the time elapsed since the context was initialized.
* Returns the time spent in the context once it's closed.

The timeout exception can be suppressed; when the time expires, the
context finishes without rising TimerTimeout.

This class can be used to execute blocking methods and finish them if
there is no return. For example, in the followup patch [1], this class
is used in the method "neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib.ip_monitor" to control
how much time the blocking function "IPRSocket.get" is being called. By
using this strategy the method "ip_monitor" can be finished gracefully
using an external event signal in the main loop.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660611/

Change-Id: I1f33535b201d49b875437bcc3397fcb465118064
Related-Bug: #1680183

commit_message:
use test tools from neutron-lib

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's test tools module
where appropriate rather than using neutron's.
This includes removing the following functions/classes from neutron and
using them from lib instead:
- get_random_EUI
- get_random_ip_network
- reset_random_seed
- OpenFixture

Change-Id: I0fbfcc7919f1b17b6bb0026fa9b98f157168255e

commit_message:
Raise proper exception at webscocket close

After fixing a bug with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603802/ the
return introduced there is bogus, we have to raise a proper exception
and handle it like timeouts, to get all the mistral allright.

Change-Id: Idcdbd38129f5694c5452f3f8aca0388df80476b2
(cherry picked from commit fee9f8cf15d708e4b3b8bdf0f0ddd6df8ce5c223)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 22:04:02.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Deprecate openstack server migrate --host option

Per the discussion at the Train Forum [1] this deprecates
the problematic --host option on the server migrate command
which, depending on the compute API version used, forcefully
bypasses the scheduler and also does not allow you to live
migrate a server and let the scheduler pick a host.

The --live option is replaced here with two new options:

* --live-migration: this simply tells the command you want to
  perform a live rather than cold migration

* --host: when specified, this will request a target host for
  the live migration and will be validated by the scheduler;
  if not specified, the scheduler will pick a host

We can build on the --host option by supporting cold migrations
with a specified host when using compute API version 2.56 or
greater but that will come in a separate change.

Note there are several related changes for this issue:

- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628334/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626949/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627801/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589012/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460059/

This change allows us to deprecate the --live option and provide
a replacement which is backward compatible without having to use
something potentially error-prone like nargs='?'.

Closes-Bug: #1411190

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/DEN-osc-compute-api-gaps

Change-Id: I95d3d588e4abeb6848bdccf6915f7b5da40b5d4f

commit_message:
Deprecate openstack server migrate --host option

Per the discussion at the Train Forum [1] this deprecates
the problematic --live option on the server migrate command
which, depending on the compute API version used, forcefully
bypasses the scheduler and also does not allow you to live
migrate a server and let the scheduler pick a host.

The --live option is replaced here with two new options:

* --live-migration: this simply tells the command you want to
  perform a live rather than cold migration; if specified with
  --live the --live-migration option takes priority.

* --host: when specified, this will request a target host for
  the live migration and will be validated by the scheduler;
  if not specified, the scheduler will pick a host. This option
  is mutually exclusive with --live.

We can build on the --host option by supporting cold migrations
with a specified host when using compute API version 2.56 or
greater but that will come in a separate change.

If the --live option is ever used we log a warning.

Note there are several related changes for this issue:

- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628334/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626949/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627801/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589012/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460059/

This change allows us to deprecate the --live option and provide
a replacement which is backward compatible without having to use
something potentially error-prone like nargs='?'.

Closes-Bug: #1411190

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/DEN-osc-compute-api-gaps

Change-Id: I95d3d588e4abeb6848bdccf6915f7b5da40b5d4f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 17:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Pin to latest os-service-types

OpenstackSDK should always be using the latest os-service-types.

This commit bumps the lower bounds to the current latest version
(1.7.0), and adds a canary test so that the CI will fail as soon as a
new os-service-types version hits upper-constraints.

Change-Id: Ie98ec9cfd58badc2b05a2a144d1d559d7ed6553b

This commit bumps the lower bounds to the current latest version
(1.7.0), and adds a canary test so that the CI will fail as soon as a
new os-service-types version hits upper-constraints.

Change-Id: Ie98ec9cfd58badc2b05a2a144d1d559d7ed6553b
'}]
commit_message:
Pin to latest os-service-types

OpenstackSDK should always be using the latest os-service-types.

This commit bumps the lower bounds to the current latest version
(1.7.0), and adds a canary test so that the CI will fail as soon as a
new os-service-types version hits upper-constraints.

Change-Id: Ie98ec9cfd58badc2b05a2a144d1d559d7ed6553b

commit_message:
New validation: ensure image-serve service is working as expected

This new validation can be used as:
- pre-upgrade
- in-flight

It's also called as post-deploy and post-upgrade, although it's not
that useful.

Change-Id: Idf75b8bf51dddc4e2165b8aec555dcb17ae9de7c
(cherry picked from commit 8f7f0f5ddeb32e2e15c03329ea074bbd8f465df1)

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-ui

The tripleo-ui project has been removed from the upstream. Remove the
references to the tripleo-ui containers.

Change-Id: I353ecd3ed04c78fd21f0108c5e1355280d3f3bb9
Closes-Bug: #1831478

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 16:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'Start/enable OVS on neutron ovs agent nodes

Start and enable the openvswitch service during host prep for hosts
running the neutron ovs agent.

Note: this is pre-stein only as stein uses systemd dependencies to make
sure openvswitch is running when needed.

Change-Id: I5cea8cf283df45c965017e444a8363278666896c
Closes-Bug: #1804264
'}]
commit_message:
Start/enable OVS on neutron ovs agent nodes

Start and enable the openvswitch service during host prep for hosts
running the neutron ovs agent.

Note: this is pre-stein only as stein uses systemd dependencies to make
sure openvswitch is running when needed.

Change-Id: I5cea8cf283df45c965017e444a8363278666896c
Closes-Bug: #1804264

commit_message:
Rework updating action executions heartbeats

New function update_action_execution_heartbeat was introduced in db api
to optimize updating of heartbeats.

Now to perform the update mistral downloads an action execution object,
then modifies it, and finally  uploads back to the db using ORM.
This function removes initial object fetching and changes ORM update to
sqlalchemy core.

Change-Id: I4cb2d85c193531648540a37caca9ee868ede3a08

commit_message:
[CVE-2019-3895] Set image owner id

This patch ensures [controller_worker]/amp_image_owner_id is set. This
configuration option restricts Glance image selection to a specific
owner ID. This is a recommended security setting.

Closes-Bug: #1830607

Change-Id: I14b69b9fb5234cf79a4d7e85de5f16df5ef7f7a2

commit_message:
[CVE-2019-3895] Set image owner id

This patch ensures [controller_worker]/amp_image_owner_id is set. This
configuration option restricts Glance image selection to a specific
owner ID. This is a recommended security setting.

Closes-Bug: #1830607

Change-Id: I14b69b9fb5234cf79a4d7e85de5f16df5ef7f7a2
(cherry picked from commit e7c5eab712e0f70ecbc6d225d4766e0fe0f3f884)

commit_message:
[CVE-2019-3895] Set image owner id

This patch ensures [controller_worker]/amp_image_owner_id is set. This
configuration option restricts Glance image selection to a specific
owner ID. This is a recommended security setting.

Closes-Bug: #1830607

commit_message:
[FUP] Update sriov_pf.yaml samle with ethtool_opt

This change updates sriov_pf.yaml sample file with a
usage example of ethtool_opt attribute that was added
to sriov_pf port type.

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-22442 : FAILURE in 1h 04m 00s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-06 13:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't get how this helps.

The bug report says the sample commands in the doc don't show output. This is clearly not true - it seems that some of them show output and some don't. But if we were answering the bug, I would think we would simply remove the UUID output.

On the other hand, if we're trying to make it consistent with the rest of the doc, where there appears to be a newline between the command and the output, we should also add a newline in the section below ("7. Verify nova cell0 and cell1 are registered correctly").

What are we going for here?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-06 13:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

By the way, whatever you decide to do, the commit message ought to provide some more information.'}, {'account_id': 27076, 'date': '2018-08-07 05:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 109e1d4b-536a-40d0-83c6-5f121b82b650"

 word "109e1d4b-536a-40d0-83c6-5f121b82b650" is an output and should
 be omitted, based on how this document is written.

commit_message:
Remove Sheepdog tests from zuul config

This was not working in Stein either. Backporting to allow us to
eventually remove the job definition in openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: I4ca37dc248ac5defbc988507379288299b19a6d7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c83e7ec2a1fe54ce8c6d217b63b3b8bd4c944b0d)

commit_message:
The automatic startup situation of tftpd-hpa service will affect xinetd service.
I suggest that after the service is installed, we ensure that this service does not start automatically.

Change-Id: I325db6829c351f0e0baad6bd67c178b090329269
Closes-Bug: #1738316

pod to help ensure the Nagios deployment is functional and
accessible

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 14:33:00.000000000', 'message': 'Minor fixups from from_conf changes

Addresses the following nonblocking nits from previous patches:

- Consolidate warning logs when disabling service due to exception when
  processing oslo.config ksa settings [1].
- Move a TODO out of a docstring [2].
- Remove a now-redundant region_name comparison in CloudRegion.__eq__
  [3].
- DRY the test_get_region_name unit test [4].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663439/3/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@171
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662865/4/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@156
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662865/4/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@237

commit_message:
Minor fixups from from_conf changes

Addresses the following nonblocking nits from previous patches:

- Consolidate warning logs when disabling service due to exception when
  processing oslo.config ksa settings [1].
- Move a TODO out of a docstring [2].
- Remove a now-redundant region_name comparison in CloudRegion.__eq__
  [3].
- DRY the test_get_region_name unit test [4].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663439/3/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@171
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662865/4/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@156
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662865/4/openstack/config/cloud_region.py@237
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662865/4/openstack/tests/unit/config/test_cloud_config.py@185

Change-Id: I1c140677347cf40db11e75f6a868356300d85071

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 21:30:57.000000000', 'message': "(Broken) from_conf test paths for oslo.config exceptions

Adds tests to demonstrate current broken behavior in from_conf for the
following cases:

- If the conf section for a given service is missing, or present but
  without ksa adapter opts registered, we should make it so Connection
  doesn't work for that service. But instead we happily allow the
  Connection, using default Adapter settings.
- If the conf section for a given service has bogus values, we should
  either raise an exception right away, or warn and make it so the
  Connection doesn't work for that service. But instead we happily allow
  the Connection, using default Adapter settings (or possibly
  partially-loaded settings from the bogus conf??).

Change-Id: I3aa1f1633790e6e958bbc510ac5e5a11c0c27a9f
"}, {'created': '2019-06-05 22:46:10.000000000', 'message': 'Handle oslo.config exceptions in from_conf

In the following cases, we used to happily allow the Connection to the
service, using default Adapter settings:

- If the conf section for a given service is missing, or present but
  without ksa adapter opts registered.
- If the conf section for a given service has bogus values.

Now for these scenarios, we disable that service with a helpful reason.

The service disabling is supported at a broader level: If someone sets
has_{service_type} to false in their config, we remove the adapter for
that service and replace it with something that throws errors when
people try to use it. They can optionally set
{service_type}_disabled_reason to make the message more informative.

Change-Id: I3aa1f1633790e6e958bbc510ac5e5a11c0c27a9f
'}, {'created': '2019-06-06 13:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Handle oslo.config exceptions in from_conf

In the following cases, we used to happily allow the Connection to the
service, using default Adapter settings:

- If the conf section for a given service is missing, or present but
  without ksa adapter opts registered.
- If the conf section for a given service has bogus values.

Now for these scenarios, we disable that service with a helpful reason.

The service disabling is supported at a broader level: If someone sets
has_{service_type} to false in their config, we remove the adapter for
that service and replace it with something that throws errors when

{service_type}_disabled_reason to make the message more informative.

Change-Id: I3aa1f1633790e6e958bbc510ac5e5a11c0c27a9f

commit_message:
Handle oslo.config exceptions in from_conf

In the following cases, we used to happily allow the Connection to the
service, using default Adapter settings:

- If the conf section for a given service is missing, or present but
  without ksa adapter opts registered.
- If the conf section for a given service has bogus values.

Now for these scenarios, we disable that service with a helpful reason.

The service disabling is supported at a broader level: If someone sets
has_{service_type} to false in their config, we remove the adapter for
that service and replace it with something that throws errors when
people try to use it. They can optionally set
{service_type}_disabled_reason to make the message more informative.

Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

Change-Id: I3aa1f1633790e6e958bbc510ac5e5a11c0c27a9f

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Handle pool min_size during ceph cluster expansion

This is to update logic for  pool min_size parameter  as  this is
not getting changed when replication changes from intilization.

commit_message:
Refactor collectd/gnocchi integration

Current implementation of collect_gnocchi plugin configuration blocks
usage of other python-based plugins. This patch leverages puppet-collectd
classes properly to enable configuration of more than one python-based
plugin together.

Change-Id: I248859bf0e4b70e3a057e96b5fb74be64f4008ed
(cherry picked from commit cfa969dac63ab1aafd7343091302c089c5cd0873)

commit_message:
[nova] Create milestone-1 releases

This is a procedural review to create new releases for libraries
following cycle-with-intermediary  model with code changes.

Teams should update this change as appropriate.

Change-Id: I80140586a4b892e2eb7804a0fd113e900f062be8

commit_message:
Add option to pass a yaml data file to be used when rendering the template

The template passed with --from-template option is not a jinja2
template. An optional file with data can now be passed to the template
rendering.

This makes the template more flexible

Change-Id: I8487e9eed940ec7a6aced3728bc857711e49bde6

Add default_policy parameter field

This change adds documentation to parameter that are meant to be restricted
to admin by default.

commit_message:
Uplift nfs-provisioner

* Update the version of nfs-provisioner to the latest image.
* Allow nfs-provisioner user to manage endpoints, this is
  required because the newest version uses `leaderelection`
  package from k8s, this packages leverages labels on endpoints
  to track leader election information.

Change-Id: Ie2727bd6bcc26e57875bea38f0f665d4a0e85bd7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 13:00:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)

commit_message:
Freeze images with a date

This allows to keep rolling images on a per commit basis, but
also upload a frozen version of images.

Change-Id: If39b0620199d9cdcc5c8f4dd48a4a74d443c7dd5

commit_message:
Revert "[queens-only] Write docker config scripts only if config exists"

It broke the fs015 CI job (ipv6), we need to dig why, but in the meantime we revert.

This reverts commit 073851d32873e8ba54a58594846c6e65d0e9a3ff.
Depends-On: I8884561e925db592e4b8b4d3b6c4df3bea8f9f47

commit_message:
Add resize_server_revert and rebuild_list_server to skip list

Since The VIF creation failure is a known issue as per the bug
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1678681

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServerShowV263Test.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 08:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Replace eventlet.timeout.Timeout with StopWatch timer

This removes the last remaining use of eventlet in nova-api by
replacing the eventlet.timeout.Timeout decorator with a oslo_utils
timeutils StopWatch timer.

Because nothing else in nova-api is using eventlet, we also remove
eventlet monkey patching in nova-api.

Change-Id: I17a4aeef3c47dcf1fc4a2d2ef0d1a712bc4db85b
'}]
commit_message:
Replace eventlet.timeout.Timeout with StopWatch timer

This removes the last remaining use of eventlet in nova-api by
replacing the eventlet.timeout.Timeout decorator with a oslo_utils
timeutils StopWatch timer.

Because nothing else in nova-api is using eventlet, we also remove
eventlet monkey patching in nova-api.

Change-Id: I17a4aeef3c47dcf1fc4a2d2ef0d1a712bc4db85b

(2 comments)

Seems to make sense to do this. I think we could probably do it without futurist using just the threading primitives that eventlet patches out, but this is fine too.

Just a couple comments/questions.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-25 17:08:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Seems to make sense to do this. I think we could probably do it
 > without futurist using just the threading primitives that eventlet
 > patches out, but this is fine too.
 > 
 > Just a couple comments/questions.

Yeah, at first I was thinking I needed to use futurist because the threading primitives aren't available in python2 and thought futurist handles it, but then later saw we use the futures library which contains the backports to python2.

I anyway thought it might be nice to use futurist and make the executor type configurable in a follow on patch, giving us more flexibility."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-25 17:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-04-25 17:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Yeah, at first I was thinking I needed to use futurist because the
 > threading primitives aren't available in python2 and thought
 > futurist handles it, but then later saw we use the futures library
 > which contains the backports to python2.
 
Eh? Python2 has the native threading library.. it's what eventlet monkeypatches :)
 
 > I anyway thought it might be nice to use futurist and make the
 > executor type configurable in a follow on patch, giving us more
 > flexibility.

Yeah, but without it, it' just "do monkeypatch or do not" and that's your switch.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-04-25 17:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > Yeah, at first I was thinking I needed to use futurist because
 > the
 > > threading primitives aren't available in python2 and thought
 > > futurist handles it, but then later saw we use the futures
 > library
 > > which contains the backports to python2.
 > 
 > Eh? Python2 has the native threading library.. it's what eventlet
 > monkeypatches :)

Sorry, I meant the futures stuff. I began by looking at futurist and saw python2 didn't have the futures natively but then saw they've been backported in another package. I'm not yet familiar with how to use the native threading without futures.

 > > I anyway thought it might be nice to use futurist and make the
 > > executor type configurable in a follow on patch, giving us more
 > > flexibility.
 > 
 > Yeah, but without it, it' just "do monkeypatch or do not" and
 > that's your switch.

Hm, yeah. I'll switch this to the ThreadPoolExecutor and see how it goes.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-25 18:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-09 22:16:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Is there an option here to not run the scatter gather if not in an eventlet-having situation, and only monkey-patch for eventlet?

Which would sort of translate to: document that if you have more than one cell, run the api from the eventlet server.

Or something like that.

If I'm reading the code correctly, for many deployments, the scatter gather won't scatter more than once. For those people it seems unfair to make a dependency on eventlet, and thus limit deployment choices.

It doesn't seem like there's any good path forward here, at least not while we still need to maintain some concern for python 2.7."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-09 22:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> Is there an option here to not run the scatter gather if not in an
 > eventlet-having situation, and only monkey-patch for eventlet?
 > 
 > Which would sort of translate to: document that if you have more
 > than one cell, run the api from the eventlet server.
 > 
 > Or something like that.
 > 
 > If I'm reading the code correctly, for many deployments, the
 > scatter gather won't scatter more than once. For those people it
 > seems unfair to make a dependency on eventlet, and thus limit
 > deployment choices.
 > 
 > It doesn't seem like there's any good path forward here, at least
 > not while we still need to maintain some concern for python 2.7.

Thanks for chiming in on this review. I was going to ask you next if you had any ideas about what we could do to solve the problems here.

To your comment, for a single cell deployment, the scatter gather will scatter two times (one for cell0 and one for the "alive instances" cell). But still, we _could_ adjust the scatter-gather method to not actually scatter if there are only cell0 and one other cell in the CELL_CACHE.

But for the monkey patch vs not decision, AFAIK we would have to do that via a new [api] config option. I don't think we can detect whether the deployment is single cell at import time. And if we have to have that anyway, we could also use it to decide whether to scatter-gather or not, instead of using the number of cells in the CELL_CACHE.

Just curious, what other option would we have if we didn't have to care about python 2.7? My knowledge is limited on this.

One more comment, another thing that bothers me with all of this is that we state that running the eventlet server is deprecated:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/eccdf5f81d211684cc9717c0c7c2bc527127a0ea/nova/service.py#L328

and this situation sounds like we have no choice but to un-deprecate it. I was really hoping there was something else we could do to make eventlet work with mod_wsgi and uWSGI. :('}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-09 23:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> To your comment, for a single cell deployment, the scatter gather
 > will scatter two times (one for cell0 and one for the "alive
 > instances" cell). But still, we _could_ adjust the scatter-gather
 > method to not actually scatter if there are only cell0 and one
 > other cell in the CELL_CACHE.

That's the more correct version of what I meant. Which is basically "how it worked before we had cells", yeah?

Maybe using scatter gather is a conf option to turn on?

 > But for the monkey patch vs not decision, AFAIK we would have to do
 > that via a new [api] config option. I don't think we can detect
 > whether the deployment is single cell at import time.

We can know how the application was started, can't we, and only eventlet when in the eventlet server? Then, later, branch on that same info: scatter gather, not scatter gather.

 > And if we
 > have to have that anyway, we could also use it to decide whether to
 > scatter-gather or not, instead of using the number of cells in the
 > CELL_CACHE.

Yeah

 > Just curious, what other option would we have if we didn't have to
 > care about python 2.7? My knowledge is limited on this.

Something with asyncio which would presumably present its own set of problems.

 > and this situation sounds like we have no choice but to
 > un-deprecate it. I was really hoping there was something else we
 > could do to make eventlet work with mod_wsgi and uWSGI. :(

I've not been able to track all the details but the issue has something to do with the monkey patching getting lost during mod wsgi doing something interesting? If that's the case is there possibly a way to make mod wsgi doing whatever the proximate cause is? Such as a fast eventlet thread that keeps the process noisy enough?

An insane idea could be a secondary process that runs scatter gather to which the api server talks on a socket? And maybe more insane: move the method to the conductor and call it over RPC. /me weeps a little

I agree with Dan that eventlet is giving nova nice things, however if we want the api-server to be fast and light and flexibly deployed, those nice things are kind of a burden. If there's a way to move them somewhere else, that might be useful. But also insane...'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-09 23:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> > To your comment, for a single cell deployment, the scatter gather
 > > will scatter two times (one for cell0 and one for the "alive
 > > instances" cell). But still, we _could_ adjust the scatter-gather
 > > method to not actually scatter if there are only cell0 and one
 > > other cell in the CELL_CACHE.
 > 
 > That's the more correct version of what I meant. Which is basically
 > "how it worked before we had cells", yeah?
 > 
 > Maybe using scatter gather is a conf option to turn on?

Yeah, could do that.

 > > But for the monkey patch vs not decision, AFAIK we would have to
 > do
 > > that via a new [api] config option. I don't think we can detect
 > > whether the deployment is single cell at import time.
 > 
 > We can know how the application was started, can't we, and only
 > eventlet when in the eventlet server? Then, later, branch on that
 > same info: scatter gather, not scatter gather.

Yeah, I suppose I did just point to code that knows it's running the eventlet server. (Sorry, really not familiar with these.) However, eventlet monkey patching is supposed to be done as soon as possible, I guess if we did the automagic thing, we'd patch it as soon as the eventlet server code starts? (Same thing you said). Hopefully that would be early enough. And how to detect it to decide things later? With https://eventlet.net/doc/patching.html#eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched ?

 > > And if we
 > > have to have that anyway, we could also use it to decide whether
 > to
 > > scatter-gather or not, instead of using the number of cells in
 > the

 >

 > 
 > Something with asyncio which would presumably present its own set
 > of problems.
 > 
 > > and this situation sounds like we have no choice but to
 > > un-deprecate it. I was really hoping there was something else we
 > > could do to make eventlet work with mod_wsgi and uWSGI. :(
 > 
 > I've not been able to track all the details but the issue has
 > something to do with the monkey patching getting lost during mod
 > wsgi doing something interesting? If that's the case is there
 > possibly a way to make mod wsgi doing whatever the proximate cause
 > is? Such as a fast eventlet thread that keeps the process noisy
 > enough?
 > 
 > An insane idea could be a secondary process that runs scatter
 > gather to which the api server talks on a socket? And maybe more
 > insane: move the method to the conductor and call it over RPC. /me
 > weeps a little
 > 
 > I agree with Dan that eventlet is giving nova nice things, however
 > if we want the api-server to be fast and light and flexibly
 > deployed, those nice things are kind of a burden. If there's a way
 > to move them somewhere else, that might be useful. But also
 > insane...

Here's the part of the ML thread that explains the most about the details:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005967.html

I think you'd get a better idea of what's going on by reading that than for me to try to explain it poorly. :)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-05-15 12:42:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

I think we're over-egging the problem of threads not being cancellable here. These threads will eventually die because whatever I/O operation they are waiting on will eventually fail. In fact, if the cell is down they'll probably fail immediately and cancelling isn't required anyway.

In practise, I don't think we need to worry about not being able to cancel threads. Even if we do, the problem is fixable by adding timeouts to any I/O operation which doesn't currently have one, and in any case the problem is far less severe than the immediate issue of being broken on wsgi.

I think we should ignore this and press ahead."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-16 13:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

The nova-multi-cell job is happy with this, the failure there was due to an unrelated ssh failure in a scenario test.

If you wanted to test this out in an environment with a down cell and see how the API behaves, I wrote a testing guide for setting that up on a single node devstack using fake compute nodes:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650167/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-16 14:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

For reference, this is from when mtreinish was trying to get glance-api to support wsgi back in pike and it got hung up over threading:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/549743/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-16 14:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Also this: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/531498/'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-16 16:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

There was some potentially useful discussion about this in IRC today, starting at

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-05-16.log.html#t2019-05-16T14:32:32

We eventually reached a theory that this might be the wrong fix. Instead of changing the threading model, it might be better to deal with the RPC connection not being available by re-opening it (since that problem may be present in any threading model where a web server "stops"[1] in some fashion):

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-05-16.log.html#t2019-05-16T15:38:33

There's at least 30 minutes of discussion and plenty of confusion.

I agree that it would be great to get rid of eventlet when we can, but if the main driving factor in doing that is bug #1825584 we may want to fix just that (for now).

There's additional analysis in the email at http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005310.html which supports the idea that heartbeat management may be the thing to fix/be aware of.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1825584/comments/7'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-05-21 14:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

IIRC the main cause for introducing heartbeats was because fixing RPC corner cases is hard. So we are under risk of moving by circles :)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-06-06 18:05:25.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Upon further investigation, we found that the application model of uWSGI and mod_wsgi is intended to pause when idle, which will naturally pause rabbitmq heartbeats as well. Changing over to native threads simply circumvents that application model, so we concluded this patch isn't a good way to approach the situation.

The uWSGI and mod_wsgi app will properly resume and rabbitmq reconnects via oslo.messaging and heartbeats resume, without any disruption to the behavior of nova-api, provided that uWSGI or mod_wsgi is configured as the default threads=1 per process.

So, instead of this patch, we are looking to add a reno to Stein explaining the issue and workarounds:

https://review.opendev.org/662095"}]

the futurist.GreenThreadPoolExecutor. Futurist has different executors
available that use the same interface. This takes a first step toward
re-eliminating our dependency on eventlet in nova-api by changing over
to a futurist executor, to be able to switch to a different executor
easily as a next step.

This replaces the direct usage of eventlet greenthreads and queue with
the futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor, which uses native threads underneath.
Futurist has different executors available that use the same interface,
so this can be easily swapped out in the future if we find we need a
different executor. Using a futurist executor is also handy for unit
and functional tests because we can swap in the SynchronousExecutor for
testing.

This takes a step toward re-eliminating our dependency on eventlet in
nova-api by changing over to a futurist executor.

commit_message:
Use futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor in scatter_gather_cells

This replaces the direct usage of eventlet greenthreads and queue with
the futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor, which uses native threads underneath.
Futurist has different executors available that use the same interface,
so this can be easily swapped out in the future if we find we need a
different executor. Using a futurist executor is also handy for unit
and functional tests because we can swap in the SynchronousExecutor for
testing.

This takes a step toward re-eliminating our dependency on eventlet in
nova-api by changing over to a futurist executor.

Change-Id: Ifb1c407df1f888c72e008578232d53a76b3d2e40

[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-28 09:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-28 09:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-28 13:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tested here https://logs.rdoproject.org/26/20326/4/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset020-queens/b2b89b6/logs/tempest.html.gz'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-28 13:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-05-28 19:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just so I understand the context for this, it seems that upgrading queens to use python-tempestconf 2.2 eliminated the need for the original workaround, commit 3bc041b47da5f23c57f97c49a66349b81ccc0740.

Furthermore, the workaround started causes problems of its own (LP 1830351).

So, there are two reasons to revert the workaround. Is my understanding correct?'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-05-29 05:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

scenario001 and scenario002 jobs are failing at tempest and seems related to the patch, can u check those'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Just so I understand the context for this, it seems that upgrading
 > queens to use python-tempestconf 2.2 eliminated the need for the
 > original workaround, commit 3bc041b47da5f23c57f97c49a66349b81ccc0740.
 > 
 > Furthermore, the workaround started causes problems of its own (LP
 > 1830351).
 > 
 > So, there are two reasons to revert the workaround. Is my
 > understanding correct?

Yes, the intention was same, But we are still using older version of tempest that's why revert is not working I think we need to follow other approach here."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Alan, Which tempest version has the fixes? Currently tempest-18.0.0 is used here for queens testing.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I got it https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/18.0.0/tempest/config.py#L742 volume in tempest-18.0.0 and volume3 in tempest-19.0.0'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Alan, Please have a look at https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830351/comments/8'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-06-03 12:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

@Chandan, see my response https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830351/comments/9

To summarize, I don't think this patch (the revert) will help. From what I can see, the OVB deployments are doing the right thing with respect to the cinder keystone catalog entries, but something happens when discover-tempest-config runs. While the rest of the code seems to agree on which cinder endpoints are available to test, the code that detects whether it should test cinder-backup somehow thinks cinder isn't deployed at all, and so it doesn't bother disabling the backup tests (which fail because cinder-backup is an optional service that isn't included in the deployment)."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-06-04 06:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@abishop, will be fixed by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662835/'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-06-06 17:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not needed, fixed in tempestconf, thansk abishop a lot +++++++++'}]

commit_message:
Run nova-consoleauth only if cells v1 is enabled

The nova-consoleauth service has been deprecated and its usage in
non-cells v1 code is being removed in Stein. This makes it so we
only run the nova-consoleauth service if cells v1 is enabled. It
provides verification that consoles work with nova even without the
nova-consoleauth service running.

Change-Id: Icfc175c49a1fc650d1c9ad06b77209a70c6386db

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints to valid with recent changes in Neutron

Because of recent changes in Neutron, like remove of_interface config
option or tranition from ryu to os-ken project, it is needed to
bump minumum required versions of projects like neutron for
networking-bagpipe.

This commit updates also versions of other libs to be the same as are
configured in neutron.

This commit updates also sphinx requirements to be the same as for
other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ibf46b4bbda9b44586d236752a2bad09820dd3761

We are building control plane images now but they didn't get the ext4

Change-Id: I6e04717a22cd459f7a3324662e8e4136d9a1eeb3

commit_message:
Increase the size of ext4 journal on control plane images

We are building control plane images now but they didn't get the ext4
journal size bump. We believe this size bump makes for happier disk ip
so add it to this image as well.

commit_message:
[DVR] Block ARP to dvr router's port instead of subnet's gateway

It may happen that subnet is connected to dvr router using IP address
different than subnet's gateway_ip.
So in br-tun arp to dvr router's port should be dropped instead of
dropping arp to subnet's gateway_ip (or mac in case of IPv6).

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: Ida6b7ae53f3fc76f54e389c5f7131b5a66f533ce
Closes-bug: #1831575
(cherry picked from commit ae3aa28f5a4749b4e4cb3f0ae0d009c0734db405)

[{'created': '2019-05-22 16:47:20.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] use iptables in nova-multinode

This patch is jsut for testing to see if we can repoduce the
issue we are seeing downstrem upstream.

my current working theroy is because we are using iptables
in the downstream ci which enable the hybrid plug workflow it
change the timeing of when the network events are sent.

in a non hybrid plug case the network events are sent after the
vm is resumed and libvirt plugs the interface back into ovs
in the hybrid plug case as we have not called unplug on the souce
node the veth pair and intermeidate linux bridge still exist when
we activate the souce binding so the event woudl be sent imedetly before
we start waithgin for it. this is what we belive is the souce of the
bug and this shoudl hopefully repoduce it.

Change-Id: Idf0ed84bae0bedbb70b5a65ee804ec1f2f4a27ee

commit_message:
[DNM] use iptables in nova-multinode

This patch is jsut for testing to see if we can repoduce the
issue we are seeing downstrem upstream.

my current working theroy is because we are using iptables
in the downstream ci which enable the hybrid plug workflow it
change the timeing of when the network events are sent.

in a non hybrid plug case the network events are sent after the
vm is resumed and libvirt plugs the interface back into ovs
in the hybrid plug case as we have not called unplug on the souce
node the veth pair and intermeidate linux bridge still exist when
we activate the souce binding so the event woudl be sent imedetly before
we start waithgin for it. this is what we belive is the souce of the
bug and this shoudl hopefully repoduce it.

Change-Id: Idf0ed84bae0bedbb70b5a65ee804ec1f2f4a27ee

In general I'm not sure how I feel about this. I kind of like the idea of splitting the rename from the change that adds new tests into separate patches, but maybe that's being excessive since this is a pretty small change.

I think we should at least have changes lined up in the other repos that reference this job to have patches that deal with the rename and depend on this patch *before* we land the rename.

commit_message:
Run revert resize tests in nova-live-migration

In order to test multinode resize revert (which is currently only
tested in the single node tempest-full-py3 job), this patch renames
the nova-live-migration job to nova-multinode and makes it run revert
resize test via a Tempest RC file. The existing live migration and
evacuate tests are left as post-test hook scripts because they do
things like change Tempest settings, start Glance, and force down
compute nodes.

Change-Id: I980177410c16ecbd809856440ac633453fa20ea8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 09:50:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix _pymod2pkg_translate when skip_pyversion is None

[1] ensured proper order for py_vers when using pymod2pkg, however
it did not consider the chance that skip_pyversion is None. In this
case, it failed with:

TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

This patch ensures that it works even when skip_pyversion is None.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/662719

Change-Id: Iac7dda35b44edf4a7af31129d9055280aa37df01
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _pymod2pkg_translate when skip_pyversion is None

[1] ensured proper order for py_vers when using pymod2pkg, however
it did not consider the chance that skip_pyversion is None. In this
case, it failed with:

TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

This patch ensures that it works even when skip_pyversion is None.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/662719

Change-Id: Iac7dda35b44edf4a7af31129d9055280aa37df01

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2019-05-30 21:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

This is already slyly running as something other than root. Root starts the daemon, but beginning with the Jewel release Ceph daemons run with restricted permissions by default via the --setuser and --setgroup command line arguments. This is the case with openstack-helm-infra Ceph daemons already. We could look more closely at using a different user to start the daemons instead if necessary, but they already run without root permissions.'}, {'account_id': 29132, 'date': '2019-06-05 19:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2019-06-05 19:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2019-06-06 12:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2019-06-06 14:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Ceph-mon: Fix security context for pod/container

This changes the  user from root to the nobody user instead
in ceph-mon chart wherever needed

Change-Id: I5d3c1fbc8f983688807b73867773bfa2d83b91b3

commit_message:
Fix ssl.yaml generating GaneshaInternal in the endpoint map

The GaneshaInternal configured in the endpoint map is used by
the Ganesha service that front-ends CephFS with Manila. It cannot be
a hostname, it must be an IP Address always. See [1]

Closes-Bug: #1824421
[1] https://github.com/nfs-ganesha/nfs-ganesha/blob/af26bf4/src/config_samples/config.txt#L43
Change-Id: I9eefa5f145ab5b17a4d93e96f4aad35d3e069382
(cherry picked from commit 7910cf3b487ba52e99bacfec4ecc86b1eeac4d16)
(cherry picked from commit b74dad7a8544d9bfa23d1f105715906464eb32a0)
(cherry picked from commit 6c92c5195e426308c7d2d153f7ac809c627712fd)

The previous version of this workbook only expected to find
the devices in a single list; with the new version of ceph-ansible

This commit add a step that allows to get both devices and lvm_volumes

(cherry picked from commit 7c89493e07b21e667ee6b93c9e00ca2f52838fc0)

commit_message:
Add the ability to compute osds number counting lvm devices

The previous version of this workbook only expected to find
the devices in a single list; with the new version of ceph-ansible
it's valid to pass the lvm_volumes, so we need to recompute the
total amount of osds.
This commit add a step that allows to get both devices and lvm_volumes
lists and calculate the len().

Closes-Bug: #1831458
Change-Id: Id5b0bb1874ea8ad327dd086cb1e48ff15d2974d7
(cherry picked from commit 7c89493e07b21e667ee6b93c9e00ca2f52838fc0)

commit_message:
Add the ability to compute osds number counting lvm devices

The previous version of this workbook only expected to find
the devices in a single list; with the new version of ceph-ansible
it's valid to pass the lvm_volumes, so we need to recompute the
total amount of osds.
This commit add a step that allows to get both devices and lvm_volumes
lists and calculate the len().

Closes-Bug: #1831458
Change-Id: Id5b0bb1874ea8ad327dd086cb1e48ff15d2974d7
(cherry picked from commit 7c89493e07b21e667ee6b93c9e00ca2f52838fc0)

commit_message:
Add a pxe/uefi/grub2 CI job

Fixes the grub2 based devstack logic and adds a grub2 CI job
such that the ironic team can safely clean-up some of the PXE
code without fear of breaking the grub2 scenario.

Story: 2003936
Task: 27724
Change-Id: Ieb395bf35e2689741a243c11b56d08a237b200bc

commit_message:
Add location prefix url to store instance

For updating location metadata with store information to the images
which are existed prior to enabling multiple stores, added new
public attribute 'url_prefix' to each of the store instance.

Implements: blueprint location-uri-prefix

Change-Id: Icd760d30e947867c2b5b87f86bbe4b1a4240d214

subject: Fix keystone fernet key rotation scheduling
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 23942, 'name': 'Matt Kucia', 'email': 'maciej@kucia.net', 'username': 'maciejkucia'}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'marcin.juszkiewicz+kolla@linaro.org', 'username': 'hrw'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-15 13:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-16 09:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I think we should add a link to the keystone docs you have in the commit message in the keystone kolla-ansible docs you add here.

I would be tempted to disambiguate between token and key in all the frenet variables, but it does make the variable name a bit too long. I mostly say this as I got confused between the two things being (largely) independent, i.e. if you never rotate the token's still timeout and become invalid, it is just more likely an attacker could create "fake" valid tokens.

I like this approach better. If you rotate more frequently, but have more keys around, it doesn't really give you any more protection, as I now understand it.

I am tempted to have a follow up patch that changes these defaults, mostly just the token timeout being reduced to the keystone default of one hour. 99% of people will not notice, and it's a better default security posture.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Seems there are issues with the cron generator - no jobs appear in the multinode ceph jobs.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)

Thanks for the review John.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-16 16:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-16 17:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-17 10:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-17 13:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-29 10:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 23942, 'date': '2019-05-30 19:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-05-31 10:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-05-31 11:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:44:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I've tested this (as a rocky backport) and it works for me, thanks.

On a one node system, the diff in the crontab config folder looks like this:


```
diff keystone-fernet-bak/crontab keystone-fernet/crontab            
1c1,2                                                               
< 0 0 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh                               
---                                                                 
> 0 0 * * 0 /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh                               
> 0 0 * * 3 /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh                               
diff keystone-fernet-bak/keystone.conf keystone-fernet/keystone.conf
17a18                                                               
> allow_expired_window = 172800                                     
20c21                                                               
< max_active_keys = 2                                               
---                                                                 
> max_active_keys = 3                                               
```"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-06 16:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 13:47:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix keystone fernet key rotation scheduling

Right now every controller rotates fernet keys. This is nice because
should any controller die, we know the remaining ones will rotate the
keys. However, we are currently over-rotating the keys.

When we over rotate keys, we get logs like this:

 This is not a recognized Fernet token <token> TokenNotFound

Most clients can recover and get a new token, but some clients (like
Nova passing tokens to other services) can't do that because it doesn't
have the password to regenerate a new token.

With three controllers, in crontab in keystone-fernet we see the once a day
correctly staggered across the three controllers:

ssh ctrl1 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 0 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl2 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 8 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl3 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 16 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh

Currently with three controllers we have this keystone config:

[token]
expiration = 86400 (although, keystone default is one hour)
allow_expired_window = 172800 (this is the keystone default)

[fernet_tokens]
max_active_keys = 4

Currently, kolla-ansible configures key rotation according to the following:

   rotation_interval = token_expiration / num_hosts

This means we rotate keys more quickly the more hosts we have, which doesn't
make much sense.

Keystone docs state:

   max_active_keys =
     ((token_expiration + allow_expired_window) / rotation_interval) + 2

For details see:
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/stein/admin/fernet-token-faq.html

Rotation is based on pushing out a staging key, so should any server
start using that key, other servers will consider that valid. Then each
server in turn starts using the staging key, each in term demoting the
existing primary key to a secondary key. Eventually you prune the
secondary keys when there is no token in the wild that would need to be
decrypted using that key. So this all makes sense.

This change adds new variables for allow_expired_window and
rotation_interval, so that we can correctly calculate the correct number
of active keys. We now set the default rotation interval so as to
minimise the number of active keys to 3 - one primary, one secondary,
one buffer.

Change-Id: I10c82dc5f83653beb60ddb86d558c5602153341a
Closes-Bug: #1809469
"}, {'created': '2019-05-15 14:32:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix keystone fernet key rotation scheduling

Right now every controller rotates fernet keys. This is nice because
should any controller die, we know the remaining ones will rotate the
keys. However, we are currently over-rotating the keys.

When we over rotate keys, we get logs like this:

 This is not a recognized Fernet token <token> TokenNotFound

Most clients can recover and get a new token, but some clients (like
Nova passing tokens to other services) can't do that because it doesn't
have the password to regenerate a new token.

With three controllers, in crontab in keystone-fernet we see the once a day
correctly staggered across the three controllers:

ssh ctrl1 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 0 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl2 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 8 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl3 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 16 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh

Currently with three controllers we have this keystone config:

[token]
expiration = 86400 (although, keystone default is one hour)
allow_expired_window = 172800 (this is the keystone default)

[fernet_tokens]
max_active_keys = 4

Currently, kolla-ansible configures key rotation according to the following:

   rotation_interval = token_expiration / num_hosts

This means we rotate keys more quickly the more hosts we have, which doesn't
make much sense.

Keystone docs state:

   max_active_keys =
     ((token_expiration + allow_expired_window) / rotation_interval) + 2

For details see:
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/stein/admin/fernet-token-faq.html

Rotation is based on pushing out a staging key, so should any server
start using that key, other servers will consider that valid. Then each
server in turn starts using the staging key, each in term demoting the
existing primary key to a secondary key. Eventually you prune the
secondary keys when there is no token in the wild that would need to be
decrypted using that key. So this all makes sense.

This change adds new variables for fernet_allow_expired_window and
fernet_key_rotation_interval, so that we can correctly calculate the
correct number of active keys. We now set the default rotation interval
so as to minimise the number of active keys to 3 - one primary, one
secondary, one buffer.

Change-Id: I10c82dc5f83653beb60ddb86d558c5602153341a
Closes-Bug: #1809469

commit_message:
Fix keystone fernet key rotation scheduling

Right now every controller rotates fernet keys. This is nice because
should any controller die, we know the remaining ones will rotate the
keys. However, we are currently over-rotating the keys.

When we over rotate keys, we get logs like this:

 This is not a recognized Fernet token <token> TokenNotFound

Most clients can recover and get a new token, but some clients (like
Nova passing tokens to other services) can't do that because it doesn't
have the password to regenerate a new token.

With three controllers, in crontab in keystone-fernet we see the once a day
correctly staggered across the three controllers:

ssh ctrl1 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 0 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl2 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 8 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh
ssh ctrl3 sudo cat /etc/kolla/keystone-fernet/crontab
0 16 * * * /usr/bin/fernet-rotate.sh

Currently with three controllers we have this keystone config:

[token]
expiration = 86400 (although, keystone default is one hour)
allow_expired_window = 172800 (this is the keystone default)

[fernet_tokens]
max_active_keys = 4

Currently, kolla-ansible configures key rotation according to the following:

   rotation_interval = token_expiration / num_hosts

This means we rotate keys more quickly the more hosts we have, which doesn't
make much sense.

Keystone docs state:

   max_active_keys =
     ((token_expiration + allow_expired_window) / rotation_interval) + 2

For details see:
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/stein/admin/fernet-token-faq.html

Rotation is based on pushing out a staging key, so should any server
start using that key, other servers will consider that valid. Then each
server in turn starts using the staging key, each in term demoting the
existing primary key to a secondary key. Eventually you prune the
secondary keys when there is no token in the wild that would need to be
decrypted using that key. So this all makes sense.

This change adds new variables for fernet_token_allow_expired_window and
fernet_key_rotation_interval, so that we can correctly calculate the
correct number of active keys. We now set the default rotation interval
so as to minimise the number of active keys to 3 - one primary, one
secondary, one buffer.

This change also fixes the fernet cron job generator, which was broken
in the following cases:

* requesting an interval of more than 1 day resulted in no jobs
* requesting an interval of more than 60 minutes, unless an exact
  multiple of 60 minutes, resulted in no jobs

It should now be possible to request any interval up to a week divided
by the number of hosts.

Change-Id: I10c82dc5f83653beb60ddb86d558c5602153341a
Closes-Bug: #1809469

commit_message:
Fix the problem that the crush map is changed

When deploying ceph osd with kolla, each osd deployment will move the
host bucket to default in the crush map.

If we adjust the crush map, we have to re-adjust the crush map after
adding osd or fixing osd.
This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ifdc3a1fd5fe37da529b2aee9811b12f744cff3bf
Closes-bug: #1821681
(cherry picked from commit 3d4a7360a7c51a1f1c806a70026a7c8b20e20789)

messages:
[{'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-05-29 15:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-05-29 15:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-05-29 19:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30413, 'date': '2019-05-30 03:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-05-30 04:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Instead of relying on role names, can we add a tag in each role instead?

If I copy the ComputeDVR role to create ComputeDVRSite1 this blows up. If we use a tag, the tag would be in the copy.

I also don't like checking for the OVN service. How does the upgrade figure out it shouldn't change from OVS to OVN with this service in the defaults? Can that process magically remove the 'br-ext' tag from the role?

Why only updating the multi nic template?"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-05-30 09:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Instead of relying on role names, can we add a tag in each role
 > instead?
 > 
 > If I copy the ComputeDVR role to create ComputeDVRSite1 this blows
 > up. If we use a tag, the tag would be in the copy.
 > 
 > I also don't like checking for the OVN service. How does the
 > upgrade figure out it shouldn't change from OVS to OVN with this
 > service in the defaults? Can that process magically remove the
 > 'br-ext' tag from the role?
 > 
 > Why only updating the multi nic template?

I'm not sure about relying on the roles default services in roles_data.yaml.

a) How is that role file used when upgrading and not switching to OVN. I believe there is some mechanism in the upgrade overriding the role services. 

b) What if the role services are override using Heat parameters? (In CI this is how services are included/excluded? I.e not by changing roles_data.yaml)"}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-05-30 09:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Instead of relying on role names, can we add a tag in each role
 > instead?
 > 
 > If I copy the ComputeDVR role to create ComputeDVRSite1 this blows
 > up. If we use a tag, the tag would be in the copy.
 
Agree but IMO this is definitely out of scope for this patch and bug that it's trying to fix

 > I also don't like checking for the OVN service. How does the
 > upgrade figure out it shouldn't change from OVS to OVN with this
 > service in the defaults? Can that process magically remove the
 > 'br-ext' tag from the role?

We prevent switching from ovs to ovn (or ovn to ovs) during upgrade so there is no such posibilities. Migration is manual process out of TripleO

 > 
 > Why only updating the multi nic template?

This is only place where we currently support compute dvr nodes."}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2019-05-31 01:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2019-05-31 01:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-05-31 11:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > I also don't like checking for the OVN service. How does the
 > > upgrade figure out it shouldn't change from OVS to OVN with this
 > > service in the defaults? Can that process magically remove the
 > > 'br-ext' tag from the role?
 > 
 > We prevent switching from ovs to ovn (or ovn to ovs) during upgrade
 > so there is no such posibilities. Migration is manual process out
 > of TripleO
 > 

Yes, but _how_ do we prevent it?

This patch relies on the "ServicesDefault" in roles_data.yaml, and does not take into account any overrides of the Heat parameter this list of service is the default for.

From: THT/roles/README.rst:

  ServicesDefault: (list) optional default list of services to be deployed on the role,
    defaults to an empty list. Sets the default for the {{role.name}}Services parameter
    in overcloud.yaml

If the upgrade path, preventing the switch to OVN does it's work by overriding the {{role.name}}Services Heat parameter we end up adding br-ex to this nic-config also for OVS deployments being upgraded.


Additionally it seems valid for a user to override {{role.name}}Services with it's own list of services, instead of editing the list of services in roles_data.yaml. This patch would'nt see a user doing just that to deploy with OVS instead of OVN.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-05-31 13:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-05-31 13:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-05-31 13:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Add creating br-ex for compute node in ovn

For ovn compute nodes we need br-ex exactly like with
ComputeDVR role. Now we can do this in jinja templates
using new tag external_bridge

Change-Id: If44e9cbad714ce3954928407c42a8dc2473fed2e
Closes-Bug: #1822367

commit_message:
Update sphinx requirement

Sphinx 2.0 doesn't work on Python 2 anymore. We need to cap it there.

Change-Id: I86275931d389c0a658203aa5cae12dd161e1c547

As discussed in the neutron_ci meeting [1] the QA team would like to
move the tempest tests for the stadium projects from their repos to
repos specific to being tempest plugins. This is the second part of a two
stage move, by removing the tempest tests that were copied to the
neutron-tempest-plugin repo [2].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2019/neutron_ci.2019-03-12-16.01.log.html#l-94
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_stadium_move_to_tempest_plugin_repo

Change-Id: Ib30382f6af434edde4b372e6af015e538768ddbd
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/653012

commit_message:
Complete move of networking-sfc tempest tests to tempest plugin

As discussed in the neutron_ci meeting [1] the QA team would like to
move the tempest tests for the stadium projects from their repos to
repos specific to being tempest plugins. This is the second part of a two
stage move, by removing the tempest tests that were copied to the
neutron-tempest-plugin repo [2].

This also converts the tempest tests to zuulv3

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2019/neutron_ci.2019-03-12-16.01.log.html#l-94
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_stadium_move_to_tempest_plugin_repo

Change-Id: Ib30382f6af434edde4b372e6af015e538768ddbd
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/653012

commit_message:
Switch to native openflow implementation

Neutron removed ovs_ofctl interface to manage openflows in [1],
so networking_sfc should also stop using it and switch to
native implementation based on OSKen.

Closes-Bug: #1831127

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/599496/

Change-Id: Ieeefd9fb4f7ab2ab1572decfcbe367dcb4035e0c

commit_message:
Remove nova-cells-v1 job from experimental queue

The nova-cells-v1 job was removed from nova in the Train
release with change I2031bf2cc914d134e5ed61156d2cfc621f006e0b
so we can remove it from devstack's experimental queue.

Change-Id: Ib916d8d2be27acca05f94ac7ce42cf75171e2212

commit_message:
Switch to new engine facade for Route objects

The Route object is an OVO front for the SubnetRoute model.  Enable the
new Engine Facade code for this object.

Change-Id: I5ce1516d38e59d3254b6f684da1384ffd1cecb50

subject: Immutable user source: Non-admin V2 and V3 tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2018-12-17 21:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-12-18 00:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ocata: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-pep8: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-queens: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1737634
- tempest-multinode-full: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2018-12-18 02:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-18 09:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-17 21:07:14.000000000', 'message': 'Immutable user source: Non-admin V2 and V3 tests

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I786499204acdb929ee341e014bcb0459d2f27483
Partial-Bug: 1777047
