commit_message:
Immutable user source: Non-admin V2 and V3 tests

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I786499204acdb929ee341e014bcb0459d2f27483
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
db_setup: refactor database setup to a common file

This patch refactors the database creation to db_setup.yml which
will eventually be managed by openstack-ansible-tests.

This also re-orders the mq_setup to be done earlier so these system
level dependencies are ready before service activation.

Change-Id: I08bde61baa956dfb190895b1d29ff3ff9df6ff91

commit_message:
Allow for multiple events to overlap

Currently the javascript only allows for a single event to be
"Current", add an additional check so we can have multiple events that
are current.

An alternate approach would be to use a generic 'Nominations' event but
this would require more change across multiple tools.

Change-Id: Ibae6644d9a11aa8ebeaac525706f24c3756778cd

commit_message:
Add new combined election type

This type is for when TC and PTL elections must overlap.  There is a
built in assumption that each "phase" of an election:
 - Nominations
 - Campaigning
 - Election

are completely synchronous

NOTE: This change leaves the template-emails broken, as I do not add new
functions for combined_$email.  This is because I'd like to
If64c075b4a799574bc51ccd13019d472ee9a4b0e merge first, and I'd also like
to avoid to many rebases

Change-Id: Id39c50e71dc91bea8034ce443287463094e2f37f

commit_message:
linters: Fix missing retired-on dates

There are a few projects that have been retired without
a retired-on date, this patch fixes them so they pass
the new gating on this:

- Charms[0][1]
- OpenStack UX[2]
- RefStack[3]

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/411217
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/596746
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/437957
[3]: https://review.opendev.org/590179

Change-Id: If9cb0a77c5d9365fb9aa4b998a0bacc75b2042e0

commit_message:
Remove some deprecated auth and identity options

Below options are deprecated on 2015, in 87fc7e9ac0efa9fbe883d4f9375c06a94396b75d
and c786213f95132df27b439c397c88ca2cb0d69390,
so it's safe to delete them now.
  * identity.endpoint_type
  * auth.tenant_isolation_domain_name

Change-Id: I64b389032472447aa3a3d38e081f9a2b000847be

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-28 15:01:24.000000000', 'message': "Floating IP does not work with VLAN tenant networks

When trying to use the Floating IP address of an instance
in a OVN-DVR setup while using VLAN tenant network type
the traffic does not pass. This is because of limitations
with VLAN tenant network types, which doesn't support
distributed VLAN routing.

The problem is the external_mac should not be set in the
NAT table for the Floating IP which belongs to the logical
port of a VLAN tenant logical switch. Otherwise, the compute
node which is binding the logical port will send the GARP
where as the routing for VLAN tenant networks is centralized.

Change-Id: I406204fc751387c02517286c87fe45533d70b93d
Closes-bug: #1828891
(cherry picked from commit c5aef51edc9843db605303ec8bd8610b6c55e9c2)
"}]
commit_message:
Floating IP does not work with VLAN tenant networks

When trying to use the Floating IP address of an instance
in a OVN-DVR setup while using VLAN tenant network type
the traffic does not pass. This is because of limitations
with VLAN tenant network types, which doesn't support
distributed VLAN routing.

The problem is the external_mac should not be set in the
NAT table for the Floating IP which belongs to the logical
port of a VLAN tenant logical switch. Otherwise, the compute
node which is binding the logical port will send the GARP
where as the routing for VLAN tenant networks is centralized.

Change-Id: I406204fc751387c02517286c87fe45533d70b93d
Closes-bug: #1828891
(cherry picked from commit c5aef51edc9843db605303ec8bd8610b6c55e9c2)

messages: [{'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-06-03 07:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to resource_layer'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\n(2 comments)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-03 07:47:01.000000000', 'message': 'Support skipping unknown QP

In the cloud layer we receive multiple filters. We would like to pass as 
much filters as possible to the server to reduce response size. For this 
we need to know which QPs are supported by the given resource. Add 
support for passing everything given to the Resource.list function and 
silently skipping unknown parameters. This is not going to be a default 
behavior, but primarily used from cloud layer.

Change-Id: I53854ddcb86b92acdb64fabeb1de4ea4907c4a21
'}]
commit_message:
Support skipping unknown QP

In the cloud layer we receive multiple filters. We would like to pass as 
much filters as possible to the server to reduce response size. For this 
we need to know which QPs are supported by the given resource. Add 
support for passing everything given to the Resource.list function and 
silently skipping unknown parameters. This is not going to be a default 
behavior, but primarily used from cloud layer.

Change-Id: I53854ddcb86b92acdb64fabeb1de4ea4907c4a21

commit_message:
Fix: Tempest is failing when octavia is intalled.

Could not load 'octavia': No module named octavia_tempest_plugin
No module named octavia_tempest_plugin

There is an entry point pointing to the tests of the package
openstack-octavia-test. These tests are replaced by the ones in the
package python-octavia-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: Iaf436a986d562643d3f49ea7eaed24669f9551f6

should remove the adapter for that service and replace it with
something that throws errors when people try to use it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-03 21:58:23.000000000', 'message': 'Support Proxy-specific region_name

Proxy (a subclass of keystoneauth1 Adapter) is set up to know about
region_name. This is done so that consumers of cloud_region.from_conf
will have their [$project]region_name setting honored rather than
ignored.

Previously, CloudRegion was set up to deal with a single region, masking
(or rather overriding) each Proxy's notion of what its region_name
should be.

With this change, (service-specific) region_nameZ are honored by the
CloudRegion constructor, as follows:

- A service-specific region_name in the ``config`` dict (e.g.
  'compute_region_name': 'SnowflakeComputeRegion') takes first
  precedence for that service.
- If no service-specific region_name is present in the ``config`` dict,
  the value of the region_name kwarg to the CloudRegion constructor is
  used. (This kwarg should really go away, but is preserved for backward
  compatibility.)
- If neither of the above is given, the value of the (unprefixed)
  'region_name' key in the ``config`` dict is used. (This should really
  take precedence over the kwarg, but it's done this way for backward
  compatibility.)
- If none of the above exist, None is used (the previous behavior,
  whatever that may mean).

This change should hopefully be transparent to any existing usages of
the CloudRegion constructor, as ${service}_region_name would have been
ignored if present. However, if any existing usages had such a config
setting present, it will no longer be ignored, resulting in potential
RBB [1].

[1] That's "Revoked Bug Benefit"

Change-Id: Ie253823a753d09d52e45df9d515fd22870c2d4c5
'}, {'created': '2019-06-03 22:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Support Proxy-specific region_name

  'compute_region_name': 'SnowflakeComputeRegion') takes first
  precedence for that service.
- If no service-specific region_name is present in the ``config`` dict,
  the value of the region_name kwarg to the CloudRegion constructor is
  used. (This kwarg should really go away, but is preserved for backward
  compatibility.)
- If neither of the above is given, the value of the (unprefixed)
  'region_name' key in the ``config`` dict is used. (This should really
  take precedence over the kwarg, but it's done this way for backward
  compatibility.)
- If none of the above exist, None is used (the previous behavior,

This change should hopefully be transparent to any existing usages of
the CloudRegion constructor, as ${service}_region_name would have been
ignored if present. However, if any existing usages had such a config
setting present, it will no longer be ignored, resulting in potential
RBB [1].

[1] That's "Revoked Bug Benefit"

Change-Id: Ie253823a753d09d52e45df9d515fd22870c2d4c5

Previously, CloudRegion was set up to deal with a single region, masking
(or rather overriding) each Proxy's notion of what its region_name
should be.

With this change, (service-specific) region_nameZ are honored by the
CloudRegion constructor, as follows:

- A service-specific region_name in the ``config`` dict (e.g.
  'compute_region_name': 'SnowflakeComputeRegion') takes first
  precedence for that service.
- If no service-specific region_name is present in the ``config`` dict,
  the value of the region_name kwarg to the CloudRegion constructor is
  used. (This kwarg should really go away, but is preserved for backward
  compatibility.)
- If neither of the above is given, the value of the (unprefixed)
  'region_name' key in the ``config`` dict is used. (This should really
  take precedence over the kwarg, but it's done this way for backward
  compatibility.)
- If none of the above exist, None is used (the previous behavior,
  whatever that may mean).

This change should hopefully be transparent to any existing usages of
the CloudRegion constructor, as ${service}_region_name would have been
ignored if present. However, if any existing usages had such a config
setting present, it will no longer be ignored, resulting in potential
RBB [1].

[1] That's "Revoked Bug Benefit"

Change-Id: Ie253823a753d09d52e45df9d515fd22870c2d4c5

- If neither of the above is given, the value of the (unprefixed)

commit_message:
Support Proxy-specific region_name

Proxy (a subclass of keystoneauth1 Adapter) is set up to know about
region_name. This is done so that consumers of cloud_region.from_conf
will have their [$project]region_name setting honored rather than
ignored.

Previously, CloudRegion was set up to deal with a single region, masking
(or rather overriding) each Proxy's notion of what its region_name
should be.

With this change, (service-specific) region_nameZ are honored by the
CloudRegion constructor, as follows:

- A service-specific region_name in the ``config`` dict (e.g.
  'compute_region_name': 'SnowflakeComputeRegion') takes first
  precedence for that service.
- If no service-specific region_name is present in the ``config`` dict,
  the value of the region_name kwarg to the CloudRegion constructor is
  used. (This kwarg should really go away, but is preserved for backward
  compatibility.)
- If neither of the above is given, the value of the (unprefixed)
  'region_name' key in the ``config`` dict is used. (This should really
  take precedence over the kwarg, but it's done this way for backward
  compatibility.)
- If none of the above exist, None is used (the previous behavior,
  whatever that may mean).

This change should hopefully be transparent to any existing usages of
the CloudRegion constructor, as ${service}_region_name would have been
ignored if present. However, if any existing usages had such a config
setting present, it will no longer be ignored, resulting in potential
RBB [1].

[1] That's "Revoked Bug Benefit"

Change-Id: Ie253823a753d09d52e45df9d515fd22870c2d4c5

commit_message:
Add upgrade check for Windows iSCSI driver.

The WindowsDriver was renamed in the Queens release to
WindowsISCSIDriver to avoid confusion with the SMB driver.
The backwards compatibility for this has now been removed, so
any cinder.conf settings still using
cinder.volume.drivers.windows.windows.WindowsDriver
must now be updated to use
cinder.volume.drivers.windows.iscsi.WindowsISCSIDriver.

The change includes the addtion of a function to get the
enabled_drivers for a system as it is likely that the
functionality will be useful for multiple update checks
in the future.

Change-Id: I34038c847b75f9f9bd1c4dd4d9a5803cd66ffc8d
(cherry picked from commit bc18906f01b10ca21a68b0b760503436caa4f91a)

commit_message:
Add upgrade check for presence of policy.json file

Correct file is policy.yaml and only needed if overriding defaults. This
only warns if the file is present in case it was left by a previous
version and not actually needed or used.

Also checks for the policy_file being overridden in config, and if so,
warns if the specified file does not exist.

Change-Id: Ia46e843ad245cf8263b97b773fac9bc6c6fe6647
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8c6355f3ccb64cb949a8280b6cd98a37e13bfaa7)

commit_message:
Revert "Only request certs in step 1"

All ovb jobs failing with:
Could not find data item step in any Hiera data
file and no default supplied at certmonger.pp

This reverts commit af47731075dd3ce7c3adc4e5630030d905826901.

'}, {'created': '2019-06-01 19:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'Make factory for a CloudRegion from CONF objects

This commit enables SDK consumers using oslo.config for keystoneauth1
Adapter settings by introducing a method:

openstack.config.cloud_region.from_conf

This accepts:
- An oslo.config ConfigOpts containing Adapter options in sections named
  according to project (e.g. [nova], not [compute]). Current behavior is
  to use defaults if no such section exists, which may not be what we
  want long term.
- A Session. This is currently required - if unspecified, a
  ConfigException is raised - but in the future we probably want to
  support creating one (and an auth) from the conf.
- Other kwargs to be passed to the CloudRegion constructor.

The method returns a CloudRegion that can be used to create a
Connection.

Needed-By: blueprint openstacksdk-in-nova
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <openstack@fried.cc>
Change-Id: I05fb4da39d2eefc91828ace02db2741b62a2cb0a

commit_message:
Make factory for a CloudRegion from CONF objects

This commit enables SDK consumers using oslo.config for keystoneauth1
Adapter settings by introducing a method:

openstack.config.cloud_region.from_conf

This accepts:
- An oslo.config ConfigOpts containing Adapter options in sections named
  according to project (e.g. [nova], not [compute]). Current behavior is
  to use defaults if no such section exists, which may not be what we
  want long term.
- A Session. This is currently required - if unspecified, a
  ConfigException is raised - but in the future we probably want to
  support creating one (and an auth) from the conf.
- Other kwargs to be passed to the CloudRegion constructor.

The method returns a CloudRegion that can be used to create a
Connection.

Needed-By: blueprint openstacksdk-in-nova
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <openstack@fried.cc>
Change-Id: I05fb4da39d2eefc91828ace02db2741b62a2cb0a

commit_message:
Switch to native openflow implementation

Neutron removed ovs_ofctl interface to manage openflows in [1],
so networking_bagpipe should also stop using it and switch to
native implementation based on OSKen.

To fix gate issues, this commit also changes old
legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe CI job to new
neutron-tempest-plugin-bgpvpn-bagpipe which was introduced in [2].

Closes-Bug: #1831127

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/599496/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657793/

Change-Id: I7d571386b29234c627f973bfac2005a5577e54ed

commit_message:
sync: use proposal-bot + gerrit ssh API to pull projects

With the transition to OpenDev, we cannot rely on the old URLs
and this is a much cleaner solution that leverages the proposa-bot
user to get all the information we need.

Change-Id: Ie5dae335c12e178928186637b7b73f97c6a694ab
(cherry picked from commit 0f4872e8232063c1758f38834d1b99cfc4ac9c4e)

commit_message:
Compute: Add description support for server

This patch adds functionality to configure server's description with:
1 server create
2 server set
3 server unset
4 server rebuild

Change-Id: Ic06d97b29e51828b29d7ac5172645c288e4ada9e
Story: 2002005
Task: 19640

commit_message:
Add project_id to all of the data model objects

This patch adds a project_id field to all of the data model objects.

This is useful for drivers to track/associate objects on the backend.

Change-Id: I224acdf4a1a946ef6e5ecb49a3a54938a6c961a7

commit_message:
Update project structure

This change updates the project structure to reflect the documented
ansible best practice when creating projects [0].

* setup.cfg has been updated to ensure this package installs all of the
  libs and playbooks into the correct on system locations.

With this change we should be able to begin collecting content throughout
the tripleo ecosystem.

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_best_practices.html#directory-layout

Change-Id: If3ca66befee3f82f462a8fc00984698e26cc7e9b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Add update lint jobs using pre-commit
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 13:33:45.000000000', 'message': "Add update lint jobs using pre-commit

Pre-commit was added to run all of the lint jobs via tox. Because
this change now enforces the linters, the modules and playbooks
have been updated so they're able to pass the checks.

> Several excludes and lint ommisions have been added to the
  pre-commit config. These were added because the current code
  can not pass the basic checks in its present state. In a
  future PR updates will be made to the playbooks and modules
  and these ommissions will be removed. The goal of this PR is
  to ensure some checks are running and lay the ground work
  for future structural changes.

Change-Id: If2095741dd0e977de71f8110307aef92d4f3676c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add update lint jobs using pre-commit

Pre-commit was added to run all of the lint jobs via tox. Because
this change now enforces the linters, the modules and playbooks
have been updated so they're able to pass the checks.

> Several excludes and lint ommisions have been added to the
  pre-commit config. These were added because the current code
  can not pass the basic checks in its present state. In a
  future PR updates will be made to the playbooks and modules
  and these ommissions will be removed. The goal of this PR is
  to ensure some checks are running and lay the ground work
  for future structural changes.

Change-Id: If2095741dd0e977de71f8110307aef92d4f3676c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Configure nova to send versioned and unversioned notifications
messages:
[{'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 08:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-06 09:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-06-06 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Vitrage supports both the versioned the unversioned notifications. Why do we need to change the Nova configuration? why not just use the current configuration, whatever it may be?'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Vitrage supports both the versioned the unversioned notifications.
 > Why do we need to change the Nova configuration? why not just use
 > the current configuration, whatever it may be?

they changed the default vitrage uses a flag which is by default versioned
all our tests failed because of that'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ifat, nova changed a default configuration and we want to tests both cases. That's why we need to change nova config"}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:06:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I see. This is what I think: 

- for the tests only, we can change Nova configuration. I'm not sure if it means that we are actually checking both versioned and unversioned (I wrote this code, but I don't remember...)

- for real environments, maybe we should change the default value of the Vitrage flag. If it doesn't match, Nova notifications won't work for us. And in the general case I don't think that Vitrage installation should change Nova configuration"}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I see. This is what I think:
 > 
 > - for the tests only, we can change Nova configuration. I'm not
 > sure if it means that we are actually checking both versioned and
 > unversioned (I wrote this code, but I don't remember...)
 > 
 > - for real environments, maybe we should change the default value
 > of the Vitrage flag. If it doesn't match, Nova notifications won't
 > work for us. And in the general case I don't think that Vitrage
 > installation should change Nova configuration

this change is for the devstack not on real production"}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

until this is merged https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662849/
lets do it so our gate is not broken'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> this change is for the devstack not on real production

I understand, but what will happen on real production? by default Vitrage will expect to get versioned notifications, while Nova will send only unversioned notifications.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > this change is for the devstack not on real production
 > 
 > I understand, but what will happen on real production? by default
 > Vitrage will expect to get versioned notifications, while Nova will
 > send only unversioned notifications.

Vitrage documentation states that "use_nova_versioned_notifications" should be the same as nova "notification_format"'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-06 11:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: Ia2c78071091a7f1b673d8ff2e03d36bbbb1ebe8c

commit_message:
Configure nova to send versioned and unversioned notifications

Nova change https://review.opendev.org/603079/ is changing the
default configuration to send only unversioned notfications rather
than both versioned and unversioned notifications.

make sure vitrage uses both.

Change-Id: Ia2c78071091a7f1b673d8ff2e03d36bbbb1ebe8c

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I846d82415330b611944354c1d261a0f8ac17ae53

This patch remains useful though in case the file is missing.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-06-04 18:33:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-06-06 12:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as If7276e766344bbdc4a92f3df34961859962106e8'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-03 13:36:37.000000000', 'message': "[queens-only] Write docker config scripts only if config exists

Do not try to write docker config scripts if the
docker_config_scripts.yaml doesn't exist.

I832a2ec34f4ed4a87e30d0c88f4c60bcf2f4c151 was reverted so there is no
default hash provided to the loop introduced in
I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b so the simplest patch
(one-liner) is to run the task only when the file exist (like the
previous fact which sets the var used).

Another way to fix it would have been to revert the revert but it has
proven to break some CI jobs, so this is the simplest way to fix it now.

Change-Id: I67da243a7543dcea7af16e964810c4c32e8ecbe1
Closes-Bug: #1831455
"}]
commit_message:
[queens-only] Write docker config scripts only if config exists

Do not try to write docker config scripts if the
docker_config_scripts.yaml doesn't exist.

I832a2ec34f4ed4a87e30d0c88f4c60bcf2f4c151 was reverted so there is no
default hash provided to the loop introduced in
I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b so the simplest patch
(one-liner) is to run the task only when the file exist (like the
previous fact which sets the var used).

Another way to fix it would have been to revert the revert but it has
proven to break some CI jobs, so this is the simplest way to fix it now.

Change-Id: I67da243a7543dcea7af16e964810c4c32e8ecbe1
Closes-Bug: #1831455

Why are we hacking our open software to work with closed-source, proprietary companies that have no interest in working with the open source community, contributing workable driver software, or working in anything other than locked environments? :(

-jay'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-07 07:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2018-08-21 08:12:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Added details of CERN's interest in this function."}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2018-08-21 12:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Sorry,  please ignore previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2018-08-29 13:48:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Jay, I completely agree with you considering the implementation of specific workarounds.
However, the main goal of this patch is to hide/change the hypervisor signature. We may have may other use cases of applications that not behave correctly if they detect that are running in a virtualized environment.
Considering that the same functionality is available for KVM, is supported by libvirt, I don't see a technical reason to not have this functionality available for windows guests under KVM.
Konstantinos is removing all nvidia references from this patch to make it more generic.
I would appreciate if you can revisit this patch."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-29 14:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Belmiro, I will certainly revisit this patch when Konstantinos pushes a new revision.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-29 16:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-05-29 18:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-05-29 18:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-29 22:07:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Because this isn't a defect in existing support, but rather adding an enhancement to existing support, I've set the associated bug as a Wishlist bug.

Personally, I like specless blueprints for these kind of things because it shows up nicely in https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/train as a thing we added/enhanced, but we've had Wishlist bugs for small things in the past too.

Finally, I think a reno would be worthwhile here to signal what's new and available with this change."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-30 14:43:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Because this isn't a defect in existing support, but rather adding an enhancement to existing support, I've set the associated bug as a Wishlist bug. Personally, I like specless blueprints for these kind of things because it shows up nicely in https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/train as a thing we added/enhanced, but we've had Wishlist bugs for small things in the past too.

This could be argued as a defect in existing support since the hide hypervisor stuff only worked for linux guests, this makes it work for windows guests. I'm not sure we need a blueprint for it, but if we're not going to backport the change then a specless blueprint is probably fine, but it's really a bug IMO. That said, I'm not sure I'd be comfortable with backporting it either, although I suspect at least CERN and OVH are already running with this in production for years now."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-30 15:28:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > Because this isn't a defect in existing support, but rather
 > adding an enhancement to existing support, I've set the associated
 > bug as a Wishlist bug. Personally, I like specless blueprints for
 > these kind of things because it shows up nicely in
 > https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/train as a thing we
 > added/enhanced, but we've had Wishlist bugs for small things in the
 > past too.
 > 
 > This could be argued as a defect in existing support since the hide
 > hypervisor stuff only worked for linux guests, this makes it work
 > for windows guests. I'm not sure we need a blueprint for it, but if
 > we're not going to backport the change then a specless blueprint is
 > probably fine, but it's really a bug IMO. That said, I'm not sure
 > I'd be comfortable with backporting it either, although I suspect
 > at least CERN and OVH are already running with this in production
 > for years now.

OK, I thought the precedent for this sort of thing in the past has been specless blueprints for feature parity. But I guess you're saying since this is filling in support for windows guests managed by the libvirt driver (same driver as original feature blueprint), then this is a defect. Whereas if the patch were proposing hiding of hypervisor ID for another driver, like xenapi or hyperv, then it would be a feature parity issue."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-30 22:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This is in a weird middle ground for sure. Like I said if we don't care about backporting (and I'm not sure I want to), then I'm fine with a specless blueprint for this."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-30 22:46:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm OK with this being represented as a bug. My first impression when I read over it was that it's extending feature parity to another driver (mention of hyperv) but paying closer attention, it's not actually. So, I'm fine either way. I'd still lean toward adding a reno, though."}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2019-05-31 07:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for revisiting this issue. Backport isn't a priority for us since we already run it."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 19:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Assuming the XML does what it says in the commit message, this patch appears to be correct.

I don't have a problem with NVIDIA-isms in the comments, since they highlight the silliness noted by other reviewers. Other than that, I'm staying out of the politics.

I'm also fine with this being tracked against a bug, a specless blueprint, or neither, since backporting doesn't seem to be required.

That said, since this enables something substantial that was previously broken, a release note is probably appropriate.

I'll scrape that together with the small test gap noted inline to make a weak -1, but otherwise this is approvable IMO."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 20:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 20:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 20:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 20:04:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

I'll recuse myself from +2 for now since PS6 is a nontrivial delta (albeit test only), but this is good to go for me now."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-05-31 23:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 15:02:33.000000000', 'message': "Hide hypervisor id on windows guests

Blueprints hide-hypervisor-id-flavor-extra-spec and
add-kvm-hidden-feature allow hiding KVM's signature for guests, which is
necessary for Nvidia drivers to work in VMs with passthrough GPUs.
While this works well for linux guests on KVM, it doesn't work for
Windows guests. For them, KVM emulates some HyperV features. With the
current implementation, KVM's signature is hidden, but HyperV's is not,
and Nvidia drivers don't work in Windows VMs.

This change generates an extra element in the libvirt xml for Windows
guests on KVM which obfuscates HyperV's signature too, controlled by the
existing image and flavor parameters (img_hide_hypervisor_id and
hide_hypervisor_id correspondingly). The extra xml element is <vendor_id
state='on' value='1234567890ab'/> in features/hyperv.

Change-Id: Iaaeae9281301f14f4ae9b43f4a06de58b699fd68
Implements: blueprint hide-hypervisor-id-windows-guests
Closes-Bug: 1779845

commit_message:
Hide hypervisor id on windows guests

Blueprints hide-hypervisor-id-flavor-extra-spec [1] and
add-kvm-hidden-feature [2] allow hiding KVM's signature for guests,
which is necessary for Nvidia drivers to work in VMs with passthrough
GPUs.  While this works well for linux guests on KVM, it doesn't work
for Windows guests.

For them, KVM emulates some HyperV features. With the
current implementation, KVM's signature is hidden, but HyperV's is not,
and Nvidia drivers don't work in Windows VMs.

This change generates an extra element in the libvirt xml for Windows
guests on KVM which obfuscates HyperV's signature too, controlled by the
existing image and flavor parameters (img_hide_hypervisor_id and
hide_hypervisor_id correspondingly). The extra xml element is
  <vendor_id state='on' value='1234567890ab'/>
in features/hyperv.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hide-hypervisor-id-flavor-extra-spec
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-kvm-hidden-feature

Change-Id: Iaaeae9281301f14f4ae9b43f4a06de58b699fd68
Closes-Bug: 1779845

commit_message:
Ceph-osd: Fix security context for pod/container

This changes the  user from root to the nobody user instead
in ceph-osd chart wherever needed

This also permits read-only filesystems to back the containers by setting
the default to true

Change-Id: Ia777bf212e0e3414909c70a4bd839e12d4919bb2

commit_message:
Add scripts for abandoning old patches

In TripleO projects we have a lot of old reviews,
this two scripts will help to automatically abandon
this patches. All decisions about abandoning are
based on:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html

Change-Id: Ief27d6d29afdff7608e35a8973c966592f1ef02b

(4 comments)

Erno,

Thank you for review, made changes as per your suggestion!!!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-30 14:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-30 15:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-30 17:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-30 18:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-2

This entire patch seems like it should be done on the glance side.

The only reason we need to change glance_store on this patch is because of the way we use the glance option 'enabled_backends' on the glance side.  The glance_store doesn't need to know about RESERVED_STORES; it doesn't treat these any differently from "regular" stores.

You can see this when you read the release note: it's all about changes that have to be done in glance-api.conf.  Also read the commit message--it's all about glance.

The problem is that on the glance side, we want to have (a) the 'enabled_backends' that an operator configures for user data, and (b) the filesystem backends that we want to replace work_dir and node_staging_uri.  (And I was probably the person who suggested that we keep these separate to make it more clear for operators configuring glance-api.conf!)  I think we have two ways to go here:

(1) Don't make any of the changes on this patch to glance_store.  We put all the backends that glance needs in 'enabled_backends' and let glance handle sorting them out so that the reserved backends aren't exposed to users in any way.

(2) Introduce a new configuration option, 'reserved_stores', in glance_store with default value None.  Use it where you're using RESERVED_STORES in this patch.  In the release note, we'd say "Introduced a new configuration option for consumers of the glance_stores library who want to use a set of multiple stores that are partitioned into two logical groups on the consumer side.  They are all treated the same by the glance_store library."  (Which sounds kind of dumb--why 2 and not 3?--so maybe we shouldn't do it, but should got with option 1.)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-30 19:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Brian, Thank you for your suggestion. During stein cycle I have provided both the options which you have suggested here, but later it was decided to inject these options while initialising the glance store. So I have made these changes at store side. The reason for not adding it in conf file at first place is that these store names are too long, and the entire store list would be long if we include this in conf file. 2nd option was rejected because we don’t want to have plenty of config options.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-03 16:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> (1 comment)

Can we just append a unique subdirectory to the end of the common location to avoid this, rather than putting it on the end user to make sure they are aware they need to configure this?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-03 16:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Had a quick discussion with Abhishek offline, and he mentioned a third option to the two I proposed above, which would be for glance_store to take a keyword argument specifying any stores that need to be created but which aren't listed in the enabled_backends configuration option.  I think this is a good alternative.  It's definitely better than having the "reserved" stores hard-coded in glance_store, and it's better than the fake reserved_stores option I mentioned above.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-04 04:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-04 05:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Review-Priority+1

> Had a quick discussion with Abhishek offline, and he mentioned a
 > third option to the two I proposed above, which would be for
 > glance_store to take a keyword argument specifying any stores that
 > need to be created but which aren't listed in the enabled_backends
 > configuration option.  I think this is a good alternative.  It's
 > definitely better than having the "reserved" stores hard-coded in
 > glance_store, and it's better than the fake reserved_stores option
 > I mentioned above.

Hi Brian,

Made changes as per our discussion, kindly review the patch.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-04 21:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I like this better.  Some suggestions inline.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 03:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(3 comments)

Hi Brian,

Thank you for review, made changes as per your suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 03:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 03:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 20147, 'date': '2019-06-05 08:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30413, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Three things:

(1) I like this much better, but we need to find out if Erno is OK with this direction.

(2) Erno had a question about how config options will be handled.  I think we can do that on the glance side by adding a glance_store configuration class that defines options for the [glance_store] section of the glance-api.conf to define the reserved stores and their default options.

(3) There should probably be some unit tests to make sure the reserved stores are available in all the places we expect to see them.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Hi Brian,

I have added some tests in glance patch for this. I am out of idea about how to add unit tests here in glance_store as we are going to mock the input and output. If you have any suggestions please let me know.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 11:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

I was thinking you could test _load_multi_stores by mocking _load_multi_store and calling _load_multi_stores with and without the reserved_stores argument and just make sure _load_multi_store is called for all the stores you expect, and also check to see if _RESERVED_STORES is populated correctly.

There may be existing tests for get_store_from_store_identifier that you could adapt or copy to make sure that when _RESERVED_STORES is populated that you get the correct store.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Also, suggestion inline for the release note.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Hi Brian,

I have added one unit test to check reserved_stores are loaded correctly and available at desired place. Kindly review the same.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(2 comments)

Another suggestion for the release note.  (Sorry for not catching it on the last patch.)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)

Test looks good -- thanks for adding it.  One suggested change noted inline.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 12:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 13:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

One last thing on the release note (sorry!).'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 13:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(4 comments)

Done, Thank you for review Brian!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-05 13:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

All my comments have been addressed.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-06-06 05:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I like this, alot! Thanks guys for figuring out better way to do it. Reinforces my trust on peer reviews.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-06 07:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow+1

Already approved, adding workflow +1 to trigger the jobs'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-06 07:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Patch Set 16 was rebased'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 18:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Rethinking file system access

In Rocky multiple backend support is added as experimental feature. In order
to take advantage of this feature it is decided to deprecate work_dir and
node_staging_uri configuration options and reserve two filesystem stores
'os_glance_tasks_store' and 'os_glance_staging_store', which can be used
to get rid of initializing store via internal functions.

These stores will be `hard-coded` in glance for the time being
and injected to enabled_backends config option to load when
glance_store will be initialized at the time of glance-api service
starts. Operator needs to insure that these stores will not be
included in enabled_backends config option in glance-api.conf.

Change-Id: I965df1883639bfd5c900d2902884153d48988f6e
Partial-Implements: blueprint rethinking-filesystem-access
"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 06:28:13.000000000', 'message': "Rethinking file system access

to take advantage of this feature it is decided to deprecate work_dir and
node_staging_uri configuration options and reserve three filesystem stores
'os_glance_tasks_store', 'os_glance_staging_store' and
'os_glance_cache_store' which can be used
to get rid of initializing store via internal functions.

These stores will be `hard-coded` in glance for the time being
and injected to enabled_backends config option to load when
glance_store will be initialized at the time of glance-api service
starts. Operator needs to insure that these stores will not be
included in enabled_backends config option in glance-api.conf.

Change-Id: I965df1883639bfd5c900d2902884153d48988f6e
Partial-Implements: blueprint rethinking-filesystem-access

commit_message:
Rethinking file system access

Made provision to load reserved_stores if it is specified in
glance. Added keywrod argument to 'register_store_opts' and
'create_multi_stores' method.

Change-Id: I965df1883639bfd5c900d2902884153d48988f6e
Partial-Implements: blueprint rethinking-filesystem-access

commit_message:
Fix rendering issues with the README file

There were several common syntax issues, as well as a few clean up
opportunities and doc8 errors and warnings, that were causing the
rendered README output to not format correctly.

Change-Id: I6bcdfc891d73c1bdd78500e1633c1284fb4bd43b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
New validation: ensure image-serve service is working as expected

This new validation can be used as:
- pre-upgrade
- in-flight

It's also called as post-deploy and post-upgrade, although it's not
that useful.

Change-Id: Idf75b8bf51dddc4e2165b8aec555dcb17ae9de7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 13:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start
capping it there as well.

Change-Id: Ie6b379f2c99862c37891ac03c52464e07bc2b2cc
(cherry picked from commit 4f467fbd73092aadda8b42e517bb60a4782064ae)
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start
capping it there as well.

Change-Id: Ie6b379f2c99862c37891ac03c52464e07bc2b2cc
(cherry picked from commit 4f467fbd73092aadda8b42e517bb60a4782064ae)

subject: Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-05-21 08:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-05-21 11:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-05-21 13:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-05-22 12:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-04 16:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-06 09:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Missing cherry-picked from lines but otherwise fine.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 08:18:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear

In a clustered rabbitmq when a node disappears, we get a
ConnectionRefusedError because the socket get disconnected.

The socket access yields a OSError because the heartbeat
tries to reach an unreachable host (No route to host).

Catch these exceptions to ensure that we call ensure_connection for switching
the connection destination.

POC is available at github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc

Example:
    $ git clone git@github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ cd rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ python -m virtualenv .
    $ source bin/activate
    $ pip install -r requirements.txt
    $ sudo podman run -d --hostname my-rabbit --name rabbit rabbitmq:3
    $ python poc.py $(sudo podman inspect rabbit | niet '.[0].NetworkSettings.IPAddress')

And in parallele in an another shell|tmux
    $ podman stop rabbit
    $ # observe the output of the poc.py script we now call ensure_connection

Now you can observe some output relative to the connection who is
modified and not catched before these changes.

Related to: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1665399

Closes-Bug: #1828841

commit_message:
Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear

In a clustered rabbitmq when a node disappears, we get a
ConnectionRefusedError because the socket get disconnected.

The socket access yields a OSError because the heartbeat
tries to reach an unreachable host (No route to host).

Catch these exceptions to ensure that we call ensure_connection for switching
the connection destination.

POC is available at github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc

Example:
    $ git clone git@github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ cd rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ python -m virtualenv .
    $ source bin/activate
    $ pip install -r requirements.txt
    $ sudo podman run -d --hostname my-rabbit --name rabbit rabbitmq:3
    $ python poc.py $(sudo podman inspect rabbit | niet '.[0].NetworkSettings.IPAddress')

And in parallele in an another shell|tmux
    $ podman stop rabbit
    $ # observe the output of the poc.py script we now call ensure_connection

Now you can observe some output relative to the connection who is
modified and not catched before these changes.

Related to: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1665399

Closes-Bug: #1828841

Change-Id: I9dc1644cac0e39eb11bf05f57bde77dcf6d42ed3
(cherry picked from commit 9d8b1430e5c081b081c0e3c0b5f12f744dc7809d)

commit_message:
Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear

In a clustered rabbitmq when a node disappears, we get a
ConnectionRefusedError because the socket get disconnected.

The socket access yields a OSError because the heartbeat
tries to reach an unreachable host (No route to host).

Catch these exceptions to ensure that we call ensure_connection for switching
the connection destination.

POC is available at github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc

Example:
    $ git clone git@github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ cd rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ python -m virtualenv .
    $ source bin/activate
    $ pip install -r requirements.txt
    $ sudo podman run -d --hostname my-rabbit --name rabbit rabbitmq:3
    $ python poc.py $(sudo podman inspect rabbit | niet '.[0].NetworkSettings.IPAddress')

And in parallele in an another shell|tmux
    $ podman stop rabbit
    $ # observe the output of the poc.py script we now call ensure_connection

Now you can observe some output relative to the connection who is
modified and not catched before these changes.

Related to: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1665399

Closes-Bug: #1828841

commit_message:
Do not assume the CNI config directory exists

The upgrade to Stein can fail on task "Remove default cni config for
cni0" with error "Destination directory /etc/cni/net.d does not
exist". Don't fail if the directory doesn't exist.

Change-Id: Ia08ec74917b6d80376f59ce04613432ad0b041ea
Closes-Bug: #1831238

commit_message:
[k8s_fedora_atomic] Make calico devices unmanaged in NetworkManager config for master node

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/548139/, we did the same change for
worker node, because kubelet is also installed on master nodes, we need
the same configuration, otherwise, the pods on master nodes won't work
properly(lost connection or timout frequently).

Story: #2005805
Task: #33544

Change-Id: I14c4dcdd1d73e2d94325974b4e55c1e37a20d9ea
(cherry picked from commit 49e5f17cb55348868720befe9bc67e065eabffea)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 16:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Skip context evaluation for non-conditional transitions

Context evaluation is not required for non-conditional transitions,
because the list of next tasks is known in advance.
For this reason we can skip this operation, that can be quite
time-consuming, and generate a list of task directly.

Also a little cleanup was done to remove unnecessary methods.
Change-Id: Ia419c47a7d71db46a5cae557fe8bc7512390715e
'}]
commit_message:
Skip context evaluation for non-conditional transitions

Context evaluation is not required for non-conditional transitions,
because the list of next tasks is known in advance.
For this reason we can skip this operation, that can be quite
time-consuming, and generate a list of task directly.

Also a little cleanup was done to remove unnecessary methods.
Change-Id: Ia419c47a7d71db46a5cae557fe8bc7512390715e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 04:39:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add new role parameter NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts

Add role parameter NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts which sets `libvirt/num_pcie_ports`
to specify the number of PCIe ports an instance will get.
Libvirt allows a custom number of PCIe ports (pcie-root-port controllers) a
target instance will get. Some will be used by default, rest will be available
for hotplug use. When using the 'q35' machine type, by default, it allows only
a *single* PCIe device to be hotplugged.  And Nova currently sets
'num_pcie_ports' to "0" (which means, it defaults to libvirt's "1"), which is
not sufficient for hotplug use.

Default for NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts is 16.

Change-Id: Ida27b52a091640545aecc982fc1a509fb5107db8
Closes-Bug: #1831701
Depends-On: I16732c9d6013112381cfad999540dd41ec3d7ba3
(cherry picked from commit 0f6dabc725b16c975023a0e3f09433d7039922e2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add new role parameter NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts

Add role parameter NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts which sets `libvirt/num_pcie_ports`
to specify the number of PCIe ports an instance will get.
Libvirt allows a custom number of PCIe ports (pcie-root-port controllers) a
target instance will get. Some will be used by default, rest will be available
for hotplug use. When using the 'q35' machine type, by default, it allows only
a *single* PCIe device to be hotplugged.  And Nova currently sets
'num_pcie_ports' to "0" (which means, it defaults to libvirt's "1"), which is
not sufficient for hotplug use.

Default for NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts is 16.

Change-Id: Ida27b52a091640545aecc982fc1a509fb5107db8
Closes-Bug: #1831701
Depends-On: I16732c9d6013112381cfad999540dd41ec3d7ba3
(cherry picked from commit 0f6dabc725b16c975023a0e3f09433d7039922e2)

[{'created': '2019-06-06 04:10:56.000000000', 'message': "[stable queens/pike] Use server_not_blacklisted condition

If the 'actions' is set to [] for UpdateDeployment, doing get_attr
would throw an error, as the deployment are not created in heat and
resource_id would be None.  Though this should be fixed in heat,
it would be good to get attributes from UpdateDeployment conditionally.

This minor update code has been removed since stable/rocky with

"}]
commit_message:
[stable queens/pike] Use server_not_blacklisted condition

If the 'actions' is set to [] for UpdateDeployment, doing get_attr
would throw an error, as the deployment are not created in heat and
resource_id would be None.  Though this should be fixed in heat,
it would be good to get attributes from UpdateDeployment conditionally.

This minor update code has been removed since stable/rocky with
change I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f.

Change-Id: I86fc82e604fbdee2881c4ef0ad6602da412a7ee6
Closes-Bug: #1830837
(cherry picked from commit 2c4004d7ace1ee540d9770d5733e050a1a62fa34)
